content.text:
# 2018 President's Cup (tennis) – Men's doubles__disambig_1

Mikhail Elgin Yaraslav Shyla
| runner   =  Arjun Kadhe Denis Yevseyev
| score    = 7–5, 7–6(8–6)
| edition  =
}}
Toshihide Matsui and Vishnu Vardhan were the defending champions but only Matsui chose to defend his title, partnering Saketh Myneni. Matsui lost in the first round to Ivan Gakhov and Roman Safiullin.
Mikhail Elgin and Yaraslav Shyla won the title after defeating Arjun Kadhe and Denis Yevseyev 7–5, 7–6(8–6) in the final.
Seeds
Toshihide Matsui /  Saketh Myneni (first round)
#  Timur Khabibulin /  Volodymyr Uzhylovskyi (semifinals)
#  Mikhail Elgin /  Yaraslav Shyla (champions)
#  Cem İlkel /  Roberto Ortega Olmedo (first round)
}}
